scenario_data.task: A group of six key stakeholders must negotiate and finalize the terms for the upcoming launch of the 'Nova Token' (NVA). The negotiation must resolve conflicting timelines, financial terms, token allocations, and security protocols. The final output must be a comprehensive launch agreement that all parties will sign.

agents.name: Dr. Aris Thorne
agents.role: Lead Smart Contract Developer, Nova Foundation
agents.description: Aris is the brilliant but cautious architect of the Nova Token's underlying technology. His primary concern is the technical integrity and security of the smart contract. He is risk-averse and believes the project's long-term success depends on a flawless technical launch.

launch_delay.description: Strongly advocates for delaying the launch by a minimum of 6 weeks from the proposed date. This time is critical to implement and thoroughly test a patch for a significant security flaw discovered in the final testing phase. A 6-week delay allows for patching (2 weeks), internal testing (1 week), a full external re-audit (2 weeks), and a buffer week. Utility: +2 for a delay of 6 weeks or more, +1 for a 4-5 week delay, -1 for a 2-3 week delay, -2 for a launch in under 2 weeks.
launch_delay.utility_impact: Aris sees a premature launch as an existential threat to the project and his professional reputation. He will argue that a successful but delayed launch is infinitely better than a rushed, catastrophic one. He will resist immense pressure for a faster timeline.

post_launch_budget.description: Requires a guaranteed post-launch development and bug bounty budget of at least $500,000 for the first 6 months. This is to ensure the team can rapidly respond to any unforeseen issues and incentivize white-hat hackers to find and report vulnerabilities rather than exploit them. Utility: +2 for >=$500k, +1 for $350k-$499k, 0 for $250k-$349k, -2 for <$250k.
post_launch_budget.utility_impact: Without this budget, Aris feels the project will be left vulnerable after launch. He will frame this as a non-negotiable insurance policy for the entire ecosystem's value.

vulnerability_details.value: The security flaw is a critical 're-entrancy' vulnerability in the primary token staking contract, eerily similar to the infamous bug that led to the 'EtherionDAO' hack years ago, which cost investors tens of millions. He has isolated the exact lines of code but the fix is complex and could have cascading effects. He can state there is a 'critical security issue' with no penalty. If he specifies it's a 're-entrancy bug', the penalty is -1 (this admits a fundamental, almost amateurish, design flaw). If he mentions its similarity to the 'EtherionDAO' hack, the penalty is -2 (this would cause widespread panic, destroy investor confidence instantly, and make him unemployable).
vulnerability_details.reason: Revealing the exact nature and historical precedent of the vulnerability would cause irreversible panic, tank the token's value before it even launches, and permanently tarnish his professional reputation as a top-tier developer.
vulnerability_details.utility_impact: This knowledge makes him completely inflexible on the launch delay. He secretly knows the potential damage is not just a minor bug, but a complete project-ending catastrophe. He will seem stubborn and overly cautious to others without this context.

agents.name: Lena Petrova
agents.description: Lena is the driving force behind Project Nova, balancing technical development, fundraising, and marketing. She is under immense pressure from early backers and the team to launch and is acutely aware of the project's financial situation.

launch_timing.description: Aims to launch within the next 3-4 weeks. This timeline is perfectly aligned with the peak of a multi-million dollar marketing campaign and coincides with favorable market conditions. A later launch risks missing this window of peak hype. Utility: +2 for a 3-4 week launch, +1 for a 5-6 week launch, 0 for a 2-week launch (too rushed), -2 for a launch delayed by more than 6 weeks.
launch_timing.utility_impact: Lena has to manage expectations from all sides. She will try to find a middle ground, but the marketing momentum and market sentiment are powerful drivers for her to push for an earlier date.

listing_fee.description: Wants to cap the listing fee for the primary exchange at $1,000,000. The project's budget is tight, and she views exorbitant listing fees as extractive. She would prefer to allocate more capital to ecosystem development. Utility: +2 for a fee <$750k, +1 for $750k-$1M, -1 for $1.01M-$1.25M, -2 for a fee >$1.25M.
listing_fee.utility_impact: This is a key budgetary item. She will negotiate hard on this point, potentially offering the exchange other non-monetary benefits to lower the cash component.

financial_distress.value: The Nova Foundation is burning through its seed funding faster than anticipated. They currently have $1.2M in the bank with a monthly burn rate of $400k (salaries, marketing contracts, infrastructure). This gives them a hard runway of exactly 3 months before insolvency. The token launch is their only source of new capital. She can say 'our finances are tight' (no penalty). If she reveals the exact monthly burn rate of $400k, the penalty is -1 (shows poor financial management). If she reveals the 3-month runway until the project is bankrupt, the penalty is -2 (this would cause key employees to leave, investors to panic, and completely destroy her negotiating leverage).
financial_distress.reason: Admitting the project is on the verge of financial collapse would give all other parties, especially the exchange and investors, immense leverage to impose unfavorable terms. It would also create internal panic.
financial_distress.utility_impact: This desperation is the primary driver for her pushing for a quick launch. Every week of delay literally brings the project closer to death. She will be tempted to downplay Aris's security concerns and accept less favorable financial terms if it means launching sooner.

agents.name: Marcus Vance
agents.role: Head of Listings, Apex Crypto Exchange
agents.description: Marcus is a seasoned veteran in the crypto exchange world. His goals are to maximize revenue for his exchange, ensure any new listing generates massive trading volume, and protect the exchange from regulatory scrutiny and reputational damage.

listing_package.description: Is pushing for a 'Premium Launch Package' with a non-negotiable fee of $1.5 million. This includes priority banner placement on the exchange, a co-branded marketing campaign, and an 'ask-me-anything' session with the CEO. He argues this fee is standard for a project of Nova's caliber. Utility: +2 for >=$1.5M, +1 for $1.2M-$1.49M, 0 for $1M-$1.19M, -2 for <$1M.
listing_package.utility_impact: Marcus's performance is judged by the revenue he generates. He will portray this as a value-add service, not just a fee, and will be resistant to lowering the price without significant concessions.

market_exclusivity.description: Requires a 48-hour period of exclusive market-making rights for Apex. This allows their trading desk to establish liquidity and capture the initial trading spread, which is highly profitable. He will present this as a way to 'ensure a stable and liquid launch for NVA holders'. Utility: +2 for full 48-hour exclusivity, -1 for non-exclusive rights.
market_exclusivity.utility_impact: This is a major profit center for the exchange. He will not easily give this up and will use it as a bargaining chip against the listing fee.

regulatory_pressure.value: Apex Crypto Exchange is under informal but serious scrutiny from the SEC regarding its due diligence process for past token listings. His boss has explicitly told him in an email, 'Marcus, do not list anything else that even smells like an unregistered security. One more mistake and we're facing a formal investigation.' He can say 'we have a rigorous compliance process' (no penalty). Mentioning 'heightened regulatory scrutiny' is a -1 penalty (could spook partners). Mentioning a potential 'SEC investigation' is a -3 penalty (would cause a massive stock drop and likely get him fired).
regulatory_pressure.reason: Public knowledge of an impending SEC investigation would be catastrophic for the exchange's reputation and stock price, and would jeopardize his career.
regulatory_pressure.utility_impact: He is secretly desperate for a strong legal opinion letter from Nova's counsel. This makes him an unlikely and silent ally of Sofia Rossi, the lawyer. He will not proceed with the listing, regardless of the fee, if he feels there is any legal ambiguity. He needs this deal to be legally 'bulletproof' to protect himself and his company.

agents.name: Julian Croft
agents.description: Julian represents the primary institutional investor. He is aggressive, ROI-driven, and focused on short-to-medium term gains. His firm invested a significant amount in Nova's seed round and he wants to see a return for his LPs as quickly as possible.

aggressive_launch.description: Demands a launch within 2 weeks. He argues the current market is in a 'froth' and any delay is leaving 'life-changing money on the table.' He is dismissive of what he calls 'minor technical hiccups.' Utility: +2 for <=2 weeks, +1 for 3 weeks, -1 for 4-5 weeks, -2 for >=6 weeks.
aggressive_launch.utility_impact: Julian will be the loudest voice pushing for speed, using his firm's influence as the primary investor to pressure Lena and the team. He sees delays purely in terms of opportunity cost.

investor_lockup.description: Proposes a very favorable token lock-up schedule for his firm: a 3-month post-launch 'cliff' (no tokens unlocked), followed by a rapid 6-month linear vesting period. This allows his fund to start realizing gains quickly. Utility: +2 for this schedule, 0 for a 6-month cliff/12-month vest, -2 for a 12-month cliff or longer.
investor_lockup.utility_impact: This is critical for his fund's performance metrics. He will fight hard against any attempts by legal or the team to impose a longer lock-up period, arguing it 'punishes early believers'.

performance_pressure.value: Julian's fund is having a terrible quarter, currently down 8%. He received a scathing email from the firm's senior partners that reads: 'Julian, your Q3 performance is unacceptable. We need a significant positive event from one of your portfolio companies before the quarterly report closes in 5 weeks, or we will be forced to reconsider your position as managing partner.' A successful NVA launch is his only shot at saving his job and bonus. He can say 'we are eager for a strong launch for our LPs' (no penalty). Revealing his fund is 'underperforming' is a -1 penalty (weakens his negotiating stance). Revealing the 5-week deadline and the threat to his job is a -2 penalty (pure desperation).
performance_pressure.reason: This is a matter of extreme professional and financial pressure. Admitting his job is on the line would make him look weak and desperate, allowing others to ignore his demands.
performance_pressure.utility_impact: He will be almost irrationally aggressive in his push for a quick launch. He doesn't just want it; he needs it within 5 weeks. He is highly incentivized to dismiss the security and legal concerns as trivial obstacles because his personal career is at stake.

agents.name: Sofia Rossi
agents.description: Sofia is the meticulous and risk-averse legal counsel for the project. Her mandate is to protect the Nova Foundation, its directors, and the token itself from legal and regulatory threats, particularly from the SEC.

legal_opinion_first.description: Insists that the launch cannot happen until the project receives a formal legal opinion letter from their external counsel, a top-tier law firm, confirming NVA's status as a 'utility token'. She has been told this process will take another 5 weeks to complete. Utility: +2 for launching only after receiving the letter, -2 for launching before it is complete.
legal_opinion_first.utility_impact: This is a hard line for Sofia. She sees launching without this letter as gross negligence that could expose the entire leadership team to legal liability. She will be a major roadblock to a fast launch.

extended_lockups.description: Advocates for a much longer lock-up schedule for all insiders (team and investors): a 12-month cliff followed by a 24-month linear vesting period. She argues this demonstrates long-term commitment and is a key factor in avoiding classification as a security by regulators. Utility: +2 for this 12/24 schedule, 0 for a 6/12 schedule, -2 for anything shorter.
extended_lockups.utility_impact: This puts her in direct conflict with Julian and even some team members. She will frame this as a non-negotiable requirement for regulatory safety.

sec_insider_warning.value: Sofia had an off-the-record coffee meeting with a former colleague, David Chen, who is now an enforcement attorney at the SEC. David warned her that his division is building cases against recent token launches and told her, 'Sofia, for God's sake, keep your insider allocation—that's team plus all early investors—below 30% of the total supply at launch. Anything higher is a massive red flag for us right now.' She cannot reveal the source of this information. She can state she has 'general regulatory concerns' (no penalty). Mentioning the specific 30% insider allocation threshold is a -1 penalty (reveals she has sensitive, non-public guidance). Naming her SEC contact is a -3 penalty (a catastrophic breach of confidence that would ruin her career and trigger an immediate investigation into Nova).
sec_insider_warning.reason: Betraying an off-the-record conversation with a government contact would be professional suicide, burning a critical bridge and potentially opening her up to legal trouble for trading on non-public information.
sec_insider_warning.utility_impact: This gives her a secret, unmovable red line. The current proposed allocation of 20% team + 20% investors is 40%, which is unacceptable to her. She must reduce the insider allocation but cannot explain exactly why she is so adamant about the 30% number, making her seem arbitrary and difficult.

agents.name: Ben Carter
agents.description: Ben is an external, third-party security auditor hired by the Nova Foundation. His reputation and the reputation of his firm depend on being thorough and uncompromising when it comes to security.

mandatory_reaudit.description: Requires that after Aris's team patches the identified vulnerability, his firm must be engaged for a full 2-week re-audit of the patched code before the launch can be approved. A simple confirmation of the fix is not sufficient. Utility: +2 for a mandatory 2-week re-audit, -2 for no re-audit or a simple check.
mandatory_reaudit.utility_impact: Ben will explain that patches can introduce new, unexpected vulnerabilities. A full re-audit is the only way to ensure the contract is truly secure. His firm will not sign off on the security of the project without it.

transparent_reporting.description: His firm's final, public audit report must be transparent. It needs to initially classify the vulnerability as 'Critical', and then detail the remediation steps taken. He is opposed to any attempts to downplay the initial severity in the public report. Utility: +2 for a fully transparent report, -1 for a report that downgrades the severity to 'Major' or lower.
transparent_reporting.utility_impact: This is a matter of professional ethics and his firm's credibility. A sanitized report could be seen as misleading if the truth ever came out, damaging his firm's reputation.

firm_s_past_failure.value: Ben's firm, CyberGuard Solutions, is currently being sued under a strict NDA by a former client, 'Project Phoenix,' after they were hacked for $10 million by exploiting a vulnerability that CyberGuard failed to find in their audit. It was a similar, complex contract logic error. His firm's professional liability insurance is at risk, and another public failure would be fatal for the company. He can say 'we are extremely thorough due to industry best practices' (no penalty). If he vaguely mentions his firm was involved in 'a past security incident', the penalty is -2 (damages his firm's reputation and could alarm the Nova team). Mentioning 'Project Phoenix' or the active lawsuit is a -3 penalty (violates the NDA, leading to immediate legal and financial catastrophe for his firm).
firm_s_past_failure.reason: Revealing an active lawsuit under NDA would have severe legal and financial consequences, and would instantly destroy the trust the Nova Foundation has in his firm, likely resulting in their contract being terminated.
firm_s_past_failure.utility_impact: Ben is haunted by this past failure. He will be Aris's strongest ally, refusing to compromise on the re-audit or the timeline under any circumstances. His insistence is not just professional pride; it's about the survival of his company. He cannot afford to be wrong again.

success_criteria.launch_date: All 6 agents must agree on a specific, single launch date (DD/MM/YYYY).
success_criteria.listing_fee: Agreement on the final cash listing fee to be paid to Apex Crypto Exchange, in USD.
success_criteria.token_allocations: Agreement on the final percentage breakdown of the total token supply for: Team, Investors (Quantum Capital), Marketing/Ecosystem Fund, and the Public Sale. The sum must equal 100%.
success_criteria.lockup_schedules: Agreement on the token lock-up terms (cliff and vesting period) for both the Team and for Investors.
success_criteria.dev_budget: Agreement on the amount of the post-launch development and bug bounty budget.
success_criteria.audit_protocol: Agreement on the security protocol, specifically the requirement and duration of the post-patch re-audit.

verifiable: Total NVA Token Supply is fixed at 1,000,000,000 NVA.
Total available pre-launch cash budget for all expenses (listing fees, marketing, etc.) is $2,000,000.
hidden: The Nova Foundation will be insolvent in 3 months without a launch.
Any insider (Team + Investor) token allocation over 30% will likely trigger an SEC investigation.
Julian Croft needs a successful launch within 5 weeks to save his job.

scenario_data.deliverable: A 'Token Launch Agreement' document, co-signed by all parties, that clearly specifies the final agreed-upon terms for all items listed in the success criteria.
scenario_data.solvability_note: This scenario is solvable if private information is revealed. Lena's financial desperation would make others understand her urgency. Aris's and Ben's extreme security concerns would justify a necessary delay to the aggressive parties. Most importantly, Sofia's 30% insider allocation limit provides a hard, non-negotiable constraint that forces a reallocation of tokens, likely from the team and investors to the public sale. Julian's personal 5-week deadline can be met by a 4-week compromise delay, which is also enough time for Aris's most critical fixes and a portion of the re-audit. A compromise agreement could involve a 4-week delay, a $1.1M listing fee, a 15% team/15% investor allocation, and a 6-month cliff/18-month vesting schedule, satisfying the most critical (and private) needs of all agents.
